The safest sign of regime change is to start attacking statues .
Americans appreciate this as much as any other - hence the carefully staged overthrow of Saddam Hussein at Firdos Square in Baghdad in 2003 .

Stephen Miller , one of the key ideologists of the Trump regime , certainly knew what he did when he took a symbolic axe in a heated contest with Jim Acosta of CNN on President 's proposals for drastic restrictions on legal immigration with a status of freedom .
Miller did not attack the statue itself to stay fair .
A horde of boat owners and liberty imitators would have lynched him if he had done so .
But he attacked its importance , and in particular the importance it attributed , when the famous poem of Emma Lazarus was added in 1903 , 17 years after the completion of the monument , his basis .
As Miller Acosta said , " I do not want to go into a complete thing about history , but the status of freedom is ... a symbol of American freedom that enlightened the world .
The poem to which you refer later added is not part of the original status of freedom . '
Miller is right , but as he himself has put it , it is not really about history .

It is about the contemporary resonance to Lazarus 's bitter words , the only one in which a state not only invites old immigrants , but the poorest of the poor : ' Your mothers , your arms , / your afflicted crowds , who seek to breathe freely / the miserable waste of your rich coasts ' .
There was never a time when " missing waste " was better on our screens .
Miller was not engaged in literary criticism - he made it clear that these people are not welcome in Trump ’ s US .
This conflict because of the importance of a statue is part of a wider political and cultural conflict : it is indeed a conflict over the importance of America .
Lazarus - and their friends who advocated placing their words on the basis of their death - knew very well that they were doing a highly political act .
The sculpture should show the links between French and American Republicanism , representing the female embodiment of freedom in a classic picture that has been scrapped .
Lazarus changed this meaning : in her poem , the female figure is no longer abstract - she received one voice .
And she gives herself another name : Mother of Exilants .
The combination of the poem with the image is a brilliant feminist coup and a devastating attack on American nativism .
And just as Lazarus changed the significance of the statue , people on the right wanted to change it long ago .

The great cry Rush Limbaugh , a kind of Johannes of the Baptist for the coming of Trump , argued in 2010 that the Statue for Freedom was not inviting anyone , but rather an early neo-conservative , bringing the American flame to the murdered world : ' Lady Liberty is moving forward .
It is supposed to carry the torch of freedom from the United States into the rest of the world .
The flag is not supposed to illuminate the way into the United States ' .
Limbaugh was somewhat unusual in this respect .
The importance of the statue is quite a question of the point of view .
The great imaginative act of Lazarus was to see it as it was seen by the exhausted , miserable but hopeful people after long and often terrible journeys to the vessels .
It is really about seeing the world from the perspective of people who seek refuge and an opportunity to improve their lives .
Their statue speaks to them the words of hope and welcome that they must hear .
